business.headline: Ben & Jerry's co-founder quits, accuses Unilever of silencing brand's activismBen & Jerry's co-founder Jerry Greenfield has stepped down from the company after 47 years, saying its independence to speak on social issues has been eroded under Unilever's ownership. Unilever, which is spinning off its ice cream business, thanked Greenfield for his service but disagreed with his claims.

IT, defence or PSU banking: Which sector is likely to see growth on D-Street?PSU banking stocks have started gaining attention after a long period of underperformance, while the IT sector remains in a state of uncertainty.

Sensex, Nifty continue winning run amid India-US trade talk optimismThe S&P BSE Sensex rose 313.02 points to close at 82,693.71, while the NSE Nifty50 added 91.25 points to end at 25,330.25. Broader markets also held their ground, with midcap and smallcap indices finishing in the green.

Business leaders extend heartfelt wishes to PM Modi on 75th birthdayProminent business leaders across India as he celebrated his 75th birthday on Tuesday, with several industrialists praising his transformational leadership and unwavering commitment to the nation's progress.

Want a home loan without the headache? Here's how AI can help youFrom lengthy paperwork to long waiting periods, applying for a home loan often becomes a tedious process filled with red tape, but an AI tool can now make it easy for you.

Cotton farmers face new challenge as quality issues threaten MSPDuring this Kharif season, northern states such as Haryana, Punjab, and Rajasthan, and southern states including Andhra Pradesh and Telangana, experienced prolonged and abnormal rainfall.
Elon Musk congratulates Siddharth Jain, India Inc's 1st executive to own a TeslaElon Musk congratulated Siddharth Jain of INOX Group on owning the first Tesla in India Inc.

$1 billion startup BlackBuck leaves Bengaluru office, blames potholesBengaluru firm BlackBuck, worth over $1 billion has decided to move out of their office in the city due to worsening pothole conditions.

BEL share price: Why is it rising today and should you buy?BEL shares rose during the trading session on strong Rs 712 crore order inflow, supported by robust backlog and bullish technicals, keeping investor sentiment positive and suggesting potential further upside in the near-term trading sessions.

Urban Company shares list at 58% premium: Should you book profit or hold?Urban Company share price: The strong debut reflects the high demand for Urban Company's IPO, which had been among the most closely watched offerings of 2025.

Urban Company share price: Stock makes bumper debut at 58% premiumUrban Company listed at a 57.5% premium at Rs 162.25 on the NSE. On the BSE, the shares opened at Rs 161, marking a 56% gain over the Rs 103 issue price.

Experts bet big on this financial stock at record high. Should you buy?Experts recommend the financial stock as a strong buy for investors focusing on financial stocks, while also suggesting PSU banks, defence tech firms, and auto ancillary stocks as potential picks.

entertainment.headline: Hollywood star Sydney Sweeney offered Rs 530 crore deal for Bollywood debut: ReportAs a testament to her growing popularity in India, Hollywood actor Sydney Sweeney has reportedly been offered a role in a high-budget Bollywood film. The offer includes a paycheck of over Rs 530 crore.

Gauahar slams Amaal Mallik's language in BB 19, says respect legacyIn a staunch criticism, actor Gauahar Khan urged singer Amaal Mallik to pay attention to his remarks against other contestants in 'Bigg Boss 19'. In her X post, the 'Bigg Boss 7' winner said she hopes his language is discussed during Weekend Ka Vaar.

Karan Johar calls Aryan Khan's debut a big night, says he's proud beyond wordsDirector-producer Karan Johar wrote an emotional note ahead of the premiere of Aryan Khan's directorial debut 'The B***ds of Bollywood'. He praised Aryan's dedication towards storytelling.

Who is Unni Mukundan, the Malayalam actor playing PM Modi in his biopic Maa Vande?On PM Narendra Modi's 75th birthday, a biopic titled 'Maa Vande' was announced with Malayalam actor Unni Mukundan set to play the Prime Minister.

Prahlad Kakkar recalls Priyanka Chopra's early career struggle with bad skinAd filmmaker Prahlad Kakkar recalled the struggles Priyanka Chopra faced at the start of her career, from industry biases to personal challenges, and praised her determination to succeed. He also praised her bold move to Hollywood when Bollywood began sidelining her.

Aditi Rao Hydari-Siddharth celebrate first wedding anniversary with special noteActors Aditi Rao Hydari and Siddharth celebrated their first wedding anniversary with heartfelt photos and a touching Instagram note.

The Summer I Turned Pretty 3 finale review: Dreamy Parisian farewell worth the waitRelease Date:Wed Sep 17, 2025A romantic fairytale, some butterflies, and a few tears. The finale of 'The Summer I Turned Pretty Season 3' on Prime Video was a perfect send-off to the love story we've been bingeing on for years.

Manipuri film Boong gets India release date after festival acclaimManipuri film 'Boong', directed by Lakshmipriya Devi, will be released in select Indian theatres on September 19. The film, previously premiered at the Toronto International Film Festival, marks a significant moment for Manipuri cinema.

Sonu Nigam, Ishitta Arun bring back Bijuria after 26 years with fresh twist. WatchGet ready to groove! Sonu Nigam and Ishitta Arun bring back the magic of Bijuria in a brand-new avatar for 'Sunny Sanskari Ki Tulsi Kumari' starring Varun Dhawan, Janhvi Kapoor, Sanya Malhotra, and Rohit Saraf.

Karan Johar's rights protected; no use of his name, photo, voice: CourtFilmmaker Karan Johar has been granted relief by the Delhi High Court in his personality rights case. He had filed a plea regarding the misuse of his name, voice and photos on social media.

Sylvester Stallone opens up about struggling days cleaning lion cages in New YorkActor Sylvester Stallone opened up about his difficult jobs before becoming a Hollywood star. He shared his experience of working as a cage cleaner in a zoo.

Muzammil Ibrahim recalls losing out on role in Ayan Mukerji's Yeh Jawaani Hai DeewaniActor Muzammil Ibrahim revealed that the role of Avi in 'Yeh Jawaani Hai Deewani', later played by Aditya Roy Kapur, was originally written for him, but the casting decision eventually moved out of director Ayan Mukerji's hands. He later clarified the misunderstanding with Ayan, explaining that the casting was handled by agents.

Why Demon Slayer's Infinity Castle belongs to its villain Akaza, not the heroesDiscover how Akaza, the villain of 'Demon Slayer: Infinity Castle', stole the spotlight and became the antihero fans can't stop rooting for.

Rise & Fall: Akriti and Kubbra conspire for Arjun Bijlani's return to basementArjun Bijlani made his way to the basement to join the workers once again in the latest episode of 'Rise & Fall'. Although Arjun recently became a ruler, Akriti Negi and Kubbra Sait conspired to bring him back to the basement. Aahana Kumra also became a worker after losing the task.

Ahaan Panday, Aneet Padda react as fans name a star after their film SaiyaaraThe craze around 'Saiyaara' reached newer heights on Wednesday as fans named a star after the romantic film. The development also caught the attention of the film's lead actors, Ahaan Panday and Aneet Padda.

Saiyaara becomes Netflix's top non-English film worldwide in debut weekMohit Suri's 'Saiyaara' tops Netflix's global non-English film chart in debut week. The romantic drama surpasses German film 'Fall For Me' and the Hindi original 'Inspector Zende'.  Lead actors Ahaan Panday and Aneet Padda express gratitude for international audience support

Mirai hits Rs 100 crore in six days, Teja Sajja-Manu Manoj celebrate milestoneTelugu superhero film 'Mirai' surpassed Rs 100 crore box office milestone in six days. Lead actors Teja Sajja and Manoj Manchu shared their gratitude for the achievement.

Exclusive: Has The Bengal Files locked its OTT deal for twice its budget?Director Vivek Agnihotri has sold the streaming rights for his political-thriller 'The Bengal Files' for twice its budget, according to reports. The film is based on Direct Action Day, 1946 and Noakhali riots.

Are Mirai, HanuMan and folklore films creating India's Harry Potter moment?The recent commercial hits from the Telugu film industry like 'Mirai', 'Mahavatar Narsimha', 'HanuMan' and 'Karthikeya 2' are slowly turning ancient texts and folklore into a new cinematic wave. Is their grand success the beginning of a new style of storytelling in Indian cinema? Does this also indicate that India's 'Harry Potter' moment has finally arrived? IndiaToday.in shares insights.

general news.headline: Pak's boycott threats over handshake row fail, no demands met, match onPakistan was asked to bat first as the crucial Asia Cup game against the UAE had started an hour late from its scheduled start on Wednesday. Pakistan cricket team reached the Dubai clash after a dramatic delay caused by their protest against the ICC's refusal to remove Andy Pycroft as match referee.

Two shooters who fired outside Disha Patani's Bareilly home killed in encounterThe accused, Ravindra alias Kallu from Rohtak and Arun from Sonipat, were identified as members of the Rohit Godara–Goldy Brar gang. They were critically injured in an exchange of fire with UP STF and later died in hospital.

Masood Azhar behind Parliament attack, 26/11: Jaish leader's 2nd admission nails PakMasood Ilyas Kashmiri, a top Jaish commander, admitted in a video that Masood Azhar orchestrated deadly terror attacks in India from his base in Pakistan's Balakot, knocking Islamabad's denials of harbouring terror groups on its soil.

Coloured photos, serial numbers on EVMs: Poll body's new rules start with BiharCandidates' photographs will now be printed in colour, replacing the earlier black-and-white or no-photo versions, to facilitate clearer identification.

As Modi turns 75, a look at what he said about his mentor in 2008 bookAs PM Modi turns 75, we take the occasion to recall his tribute to a senior RSS veteran, Laxmanrao Inamdar, who helped shape his early years. Modi mentions him in his 2008 book, Jyotipunj.

Repeat-offender street dogs to get life imprisonment in UPThe government of Uttar Pradesh has rolled out tough new rules against street dogs, mandating life imprisonment for repeat attackers. The move follows a Supreme Court ruling that sought to tackle the street-dog menace in Delhi NCR.

Ask the deity itself: CJI Gavai's remark on plea to restore Vishnu idol stirs rowA bench led by Chief Justice of India BR Gavai rejected a plea seeking the restoration of a damaged Lord Vishnu idol in Madhya Pradesh. However, the CJI's remarks to the petitioner were perceived as insensitive by a section of advocates.

From Israel to Australia, leaders line up with rare video wishes for PMAs Prime Minister Narendra Modi celebrated his 75th birthday, a string of video messages from several world leaders flooded social media in a rare move.

University of Bath School of Management: Where Careers Begin With ConfidenceWith students from over 160 countries and a strong alumni network spanning 130 nations, the School creates a community that feels global in reach yet personal in experience.

Aishwarya-Abhishek film shelved as producer was wife-beater: Prahlad KakkarPrahlad Kakkar reveals why the film featuring Aishwarya Rai, Abhishek Bachchan, and Amitabh Bachchan was cancelled, sharing insights into the casting, production issues, and his long-standing association with Aishwarya Rai.

Man rams car into FBI Pittsburgh HQ gate, manhunt for suspect launchedThe suspect crashed a white Toyota sedan into the entrance gate of FBI Pittsburgh HQ at around 2.40 am.

PM thanks Putin for birthday wish, stresses India's 'special' ties with RussiaPrime Minister Narendra Modi marked his 75th birthday on Wednesday with warm wishes from world leaders, including Russian President Vladimir Putin.

Don't let a Khan become mayor: BJP Mumbai chief's shocker ahead of pollsBJP's Ameet Satam made the controversial remarks at the Vijay Sankalp Melava, which was attended by Devendra Fadnavis and Union Minister Piyush Goyal.

sports.headline: Pakistan's expectations were never going to be met by the ICC: Atul WassanFormer India cricketer Atul Wassan has said that Pakistan's demands were never going to be met by the ICC. Pakistan Cricket Board (PCB) had demanded the removal of match referee Andy Pycroft from officiating duties during their fixture against the UAE. However, their demands haven't been met by the ICC and their fixture against UAE is going ahead.

Jose Mourinho poised for Benfica return after Bruno Lage exitJose Mourinho is in line to return to Benfica as head coach following Bruno Lage's dismissal. The move aims to revive the club's fortunes after poor league and Champions League performances.

Day 4 Highlights: Neeraj Chopra aces qualifiersWorld Athletics Championships Day 5 Highlights: Arshad Nadeem has qualified for the final of men's javelin with a last ditch effort. He will face off against Neeraj Chopra tomorrow in Tokyo.

Random bump 2.0: Viswanathan Anand welcomes back R Vaishali after Grand Swiss winViswanathan Anand bumped into R Vaishali, the two-time Grand Swiss winner, which sparked a fun social media post from the former. Viashali retruned home after defending her Grand Sweiss crown.

Santner ruled out, Jamieson returns in New Zealand squad for Australia T20IsNZ vs AUS T20I series: Mitchell Santner has been ruled out of the Chappell-Hadlee T20I series against Australia after abdominal surgery, with Michael Bracewell stepping in as captain.

Yannick Noah backs Djokovic, warns against writing him off too soonYannick Noah praises Novak Djokovic's resilience and potential to win his 25th Grand Slam. He warns against underestimating Djokovic despite the rise of younger stars like Alcaraz and Sinner.

Their appointments aim to strengthen the BCCI's talent identification process.

Their appointments aim to strengthen the BCCI's talent identification process.

7 months after shock trade, Luka Doncic opens up on his move to LakersLuka Doncic was surprised with his trade from Dallas Mavericks to Los Angeles Lakers. He stated that he respects both fanbases and is focused on his future with the Lakers.

Super 4 Scenario: How can Bangladesh, Afghanistan, Sri Lanka qualifyAsia Cup 2025 sees a key Group B clash between Sri Lanka and Afghanistan in Dubai. The match will decide who advances to the Super Four and could lead to surprising eliminations.

All you need to know about BMSD 2025Krafton India launches BGMI Showdown 2025 in Hyderabad featuring 48 top teams. The tournament offers a Rs 1 crore prize and qualifying slots for international championships.

Lalchand Rajput says UAE not intimidated by Pakistan: We've played them in tri-seriesUAE coach Lalchand Rajput backed his team to play fearless cricket against Pakistan in their do-or-die Asia Cup 2025 clash, buoyed by recent strong performances and belief from the tri-series.

World Athletics Champs Day 5 schedule: Neeraj Chopra and Animesh Kujur headline busy day for IndiaIndia's Day 5 at the World Athletics Championships in Tokyo spotlights Neeraj Chopra in javelin and Animesh Kujur in the 200m, with multiple athletes across field and track events aiming for strong qualification performances.

Under-pressure Pakistan face resilient UAE in tricky do-or-die clashAsia Cup 2025, PAK vs UAE: Salman Agha's Pakistan and Muhammad Waseem's UAE are set to lock horns in a crucial Group A clash on Wednesday at the Dubai International Cricket Stadium.

Vishy Anand remembers best Gujarati thali ever. Guess who treated him to it?As India celebrates Prime Minister Narendra Modi's 75th birthday, tributes have poured in from across the nation. Grandmaster Viswanathan Anand recalled a moment with the Prime Minister that went far beyond the chessboard.

Champions League: Real Madrid edge Marseille, Juventus and Dortmund share goal festReal Madrid secured a 2-1 win over Marseille thanks to Kylian Mbappe's penalties, despite playing the final stages with 10 men. Juventus and Borussia Dortmund shared a thrilling 4-4 draw, with all eight goals coming after the break.

Abusing Suryakumar Yadav is total stupidity: Madan Lal slams Mohammad YousufMadan Lal condemned Mohammad Yousuf's derogatory remark on Suryakumar Yadav, branding it "stupidity" unworthy of a former cricketer. The controversy added fuel to an already tense India-Pakistan clash marked by handshake snubs and PCB protests.

Javelin: Neeraj and Arshad in focus as 4 Indians eye berths in finalWorld Athletics Championships 2025: While the spotlight will be on defending champion Neeraj Chopra and Olympic champion Arshad Nadeem, as many as four Indians will look to make it to the final. The qualification round gets underway at 3:40 pm IST with 84.50m being the automatic qualification mark.

Neeraj Chopra vs Arshad Nadeem: How the India vs Pakistan javelin rivalry stacks upNeeraj Chopra vs Arshad Nadeem, World Athletics Championships: India's Neeraj Chopra holds a commanding 9-1 lead in head-to-head contests against Pakistan's Arshad Nadeem in men's javelin throw. Their rivalry has become one of the most compelling storylines in international athletics, especially on the stage of the Olympics and World Championships.

Whisper to roar: Sarvesh Kushare's leap into the world's eliteSarvesh Kushare cleared 2.28m to finish sixth in Tokyo, the highest-ever by an Indian high jumper at a World Championship, turning a world ranking of 38 into a stage where his belief outjumped expectations.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
